required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: An EGFR-TKIs Benefit Non-small Cell Lung Carcinoma Patients Identification Strategy Using Molecular Imaging

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators developed 18F-MPG as a targeted molecular imaging agent for noninvasive and repeatable detecting EGFR-activating mutational status.

detailed_description.textblock: The goal of investigators were to evaluate the use of 18F-MPG as a novel PET/CT radiotracer to monitor EGFR-activating mutational status and identify EGFR-TKIs benefit NSCLC patients. the investigators want to evaluated the use of 18F-MPG in lung cancer imaging in adult NSCLC patients with different EGFR mutational status of primary and metastatic cancers.

primary_outcome.measure: tumor SUVmax value of 18F-MPG PET/CT Imaging
primary_outcome.description: To quantify the accumulation, a volume of interest using a 3-D sphere, was placed over the primary lung tumor, lymph nodes and distant metastases avoiding necrosis, blood vessels and normal lung tissue as much as possible on a workstation (Advantage Workstation 4.6; GE Healthcare). The maximum standard uptake value (SUVmax) normalized to body weight (kBq/mL) was calculated within the region of interest.

arm_group.description: Patients in this group had EGFR-activating mutant tumors and did not receive any treatment before this study.
Patients with EGFR-activating mutant tumors were receiving EGFR-TKIs during this study.
Patients with EGFR-activating mutant tumors were receiving chemotherapy during this study.
Patients in this group had EGFR wild-type tumors and did not receive any treatment before this study.
Patients in this group had EGFR wild-type tumors and were receiving chemotherapy during this study.
Patients without the EGFR mutational status measurement results and did not receive any treatments were classified in this group

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Advanced NSCLC
- 18 years or older
- A life expectancy of at least 12 weeks
- Presence of a malignant lesion within the chest of at least 0.5 cm diameter as measured by computed tomography (CT)
- Written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Claustrophobia
- Pregnancy
- Metal implants in the thorax

overall_official.affiliation: The Fourth Hospital of Harbin Medical University

facility.name: TOF-PET/CT/MR center of the Fourth Hospital of Harbin Medical University
